<!-- Thanks for filing an issue! Before hitting the button, please answer these questions.-->

**Is this a request for help?** No

**What keywords did you search in Kubernetes issues before filing this one?** static manifest

---

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?** (choose one): Bug report

**Kubernetes version** (use `kubectl version`):
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"6", GitVersion:"v1.6.1", GitCommit:"b0b7a323cc5a4a2019b2e9520c21c7830b7f708e", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-04-03T20:44:38Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"6", GitVersion:"v1.6.0", GitCommit:"fff5156092b56e6bd60fff75aad4dc9de6b6ef37", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-03-28T16:24:30Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```

**Environment**:
- **Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: Bare metal and reproduced in Vagrant
- **OS** (e.g. from /etc/os-release): `Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS`
- **Kernel** (e.g. `uname -a`): `Linux ubuntu-xenial 4.4.0-47-generic #68-Ubuntu SMP Wed Oct 26 19:39:52 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux`
- **Install tools**: custom scratch install and reproduced with kubeadm
- **Others**: Calico for networking. Used http://docs.projectcalico.org/v2.1/getting-started/kubernetes/installation/hosted/kubeadm/1.6/calico.yaml (Also able to reproduce without calico)


**What happened**:
Modified one of the static manifest files in `/etc/kubernetes/manifests/`. The kubelet killed the running pod and did NOT create a new pod. (waited 30 minutes, still no pod) 

**What you expected to happen**:
Kubelet should have killed the pod and started a new one.

**How to reproduce it** (as minimally and precisely as possible):
Started with single node, vanilla Ubuntu Xenial, installed kubernetes via kubeadm, nothing special.
Modify `/etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-controller-manager.yaml`, for example change the logging level or even just whitespace at the end of the file.
Observe the kubelet kill the controller manager pod, and does not restart it.

**Anything else we need to know**:
If I remove the file from the directory, and then replace the file, kubelet will start it up.

Kubelet logs from the period where I updated the file: https://gist.github.com/dwradcliffe/797d7e8406b0cac5e0e433b456ea1af7
title: Kubelet does not restart static manifest pods correctly in 1.6
